title: Bethel Heights 2016 Justice Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This sappy, silky, supple selection focuses on black fruits and blacker barrel flavors. Cherry, licorice, tar, char and espresso combine, all in proportion and without showing any burnt edges. The big ripe fruit packs a punch.

title: Bianchi 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Lavish aromas of vanilla and pound cake with a black-currant frosting show with a pinch of pepper on the inviting nose of this bottling. There is a great range of flavor on the palate, from boysenberry juice to potpourri to roasted meat, and it all rides strong acid across the lightly tannic structure.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 Ayler Kupp Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Exuberant fruit and spine-tingling acidity calibrate beautifully in this zesty, light-bodied Spätlese. Yellow cherry, peach and grapefruit flavors are luscious and penetrating on the palate. The finish lingers on notes of honey and lime. It's lovely already, but should improve through 2030.

title: Bodegas Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia 2014 Macán Clásico  (Rioja)
description: Rooty aromas of foresty berry fruits are not that bright or lively, maybe a reflection of 2014's rainy conditions? However, this remains deep and flush on the palate. Oaky berry flavors are a touch soft and mushy, again reflective of the year. Wood spice and bacon flavors on the finish are welcome; drink through 2025.
winery: Bodegas Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia

title: Borgogno 2013 Fossati  (Barolo)
description: Enticing scents of violet, rose and wild berry mingle with aromatic herb and menthol notes. On the polished, elegantly structured palate, refined tannins and vibrant acidity support sour cherry, strawberry, mint and star anise. It's still youthfully austere and needs a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2021–2028.

title: Castell 2015 Casteller Schlossberg Gold Cap Trocken GG Silvaner (Franken)
description: Hints of smoke and crushed earth juxtapose zesty herb and lemon on the nose here. It's a dry, full-bodied wine with a rich, textural mouthfeel and juicy white peach and yellow cherry flavors. Slightly warming on the finish but balanced by fresh acidity and a rim of delicate bitters.
designation: Casteller Schlossberg Gold Cap Trocken GG

title: Contino 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry and oak aromas are not overly deep. On the palate, this is more defined, with lively acidity and popping fruit. Plum, spiced berry and currant flavors end with chocolaty oak, nutmeg and blueberry notes. Unlike most Contino wines, this one seems ready for near-term consumption; drink through 2024.

title: Cristom 2016 Marjorie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This vineyard has the lowest production and gets the most (75%) new French oak. Black fruits abound, with generous streaks of cola and mocha. The tannins are substantial, the mouthfeel a bit grainy, and there's a pleasing, chewy toasty character to the finish.

title: Crocker & Starr 2014 Bridesmaid Red (Napa Valley)
description: Sophisticated, dry and well structured, this Bordeaux-style blend from winemaker Pam Starr is big and flavorful while achieving good balance, too. It has perfumed oak aromas, opulent black-cherry and blackberry flavors, lots of velvety tannins for grip and enough concentration for a lingering finish.

title: Daou 2016 Unbound Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black currant and smashed black plum meet with crushed slate and turned loam on the deep and dark nose of this blend of 81% Petite Sirah, 14% Tannat and 5% Tempranillo. Thick with grippy but smooth tannins, and wrapped in a buoyant acidity, the brawny blend offers the darkest and driest of fruit flavors.

title: Davies 2016 Goorgian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a very flavorful, medium- to full-bodied wine that blends ripe black cherry and clove with hints of vanilla and cinnamon. Supportive fruit acidity and light tannins add structure for an appetizing mouthfeel.

title: De Ponte Cellars 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Richly fruity and lushly textured, this palate-coating Pinot offers a wealth of fruit flavors revolving around berry jam. Details of spice and nougat compound the finish, and a rather light touch of new French oak keeps everything in perfect proportion.

title: Domaine de la Combe 2016 Réserve Personelle Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This wine is from the oldest vines in this Gadais family vineyard. It is full and concentrated. After 14 months lees aging and waiting for a year before release, it is now ready to drink. Its combination of mineral, apple and citrus is delicious and rich.

title: Domaine Eden 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Like its bigger Mount Eden sister, this more affordable, usually more immediately accessible bottling needs time to open up. With patience, aromas of honeysuckle, oak and nuts provide a savory impression. The palate combines grapefruit pith and Meyer lemon rinds with savory salt and nuts.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2016 Les Romains  (Sancerre)
description: One of a series of single-vineyard wines from this producer, this wine's name is a reminder that the Romans were here. Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, the wine offers pure, strong acidity as well as intense white fruits. It is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Serene 2015 Abbey Oaks Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This is the winery's only vineyard outside of the Dundee Hills AVA, and it stands out for its aromatic blend of Asian spices, backed with a hint of graphite. The fruit touches on a cherry cola flavor—not a criticism at all—and the wine continues through a finish with excellent depth and texture.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This reserve white is tangled in tones of brioche and crème brûlée, with a bright shock of lively acidity that supports an underlying cradle of toasted oak. Stone, quince and a spark of lemon meringue add intrigue to the midpalate. Best 2020–2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard

title: Duck Pond 2016 Front Yard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Lovely aromas include a whiff of meat along with ripe berries, oranges and Bing cherries. This is the winery's most limited selection and saw the most new French oak, adding a pleasing toasty note to the finish. There's a suggestion of coffee grounds, and everything is already in good proportion. Drink now–2025.

title: Epiphany 2015 Revelation Rodney's Vineyard Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of 53% Syrah and 47% Grenache is well integrated on those nose with candied blackberry and lilac aromas. A chalky mouthfeel presents flavors of dark berry, cedar and slate on the palate, which is extremely well structured and should last for years. Drink now–2030.

title: Fera Mena 2015 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Stemmy and carbonic in nature, this wine exudes earthy forest, with bright, fresh up-front notes of strawberry, lemon and grapefruit peel. Light and on the precipice of ripeness, it dances that fine line well, offering up plenty of subtle flavor within a world of complexity.
